h1: Calories in Two Strips of Bacon
assumptions: Standard pork bacon strips, pan-fried until crispy; average weight ~8 g per cooked strip, no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat drainage. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two strips of cooked bacon provide ~86 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to turkey bacon per strip

faqs.q: How many calories in one strip of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal per standard cooked pork bacon strip.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in two strips of bacon?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.6 g total fat, including 2.2 g saturated fat.
Very few—about 0.2 g carbs in two strips, with 0 g fiber.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in two strips of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 384 mg, which can vary by brand and curing.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yes—frying retains more fat than baking or microwaving with draining.
